caption:
This photograph captures a lively, outdoor scene involving several individuals engaged in an art installation or interactive activity involving large, geometric structures made of yellow canes or tubes, arranged to form a sphere-like shape. The focus of the image is on a man with a beard and a woman with long hair, positioned on opposite sides of one of these sphere-like structures. The man appears to be in his mid-30s and is wearing a brown T-shirt, while the woman, also appearing to be in her mid-30s, wears a light-colored top.

Behind the central figures, other participants can be seen. One individual, partially visible in the background, wears a blue shirt and another, a woman, has an embroidered white blouse. The setting appears to be a sunny day, possibly in a public square or park, given the presence of trees and wooden structures that resemble market booths in the distance. The atmosphere is casual and the event seems to gather a crowd engaged in either constructing or interacting with the installation. The slightly faded quality of the photograph suggests it might be from a few decades ago, giving it a vintage feel.
title: August brings the "D'aug Days" to Fountain Square. "D'aug Days" is a month-long festival of arts presented to, for, and sometimes by, the people. See-through sculpture by Dennis Valensky of Chicago. Sculpture consists of a series of wire hoops covered with gauze and tied together. Hoops are supplied and people can add them at will.
